 Experience Accessibility Test Engineer Google April 2012  – Present (3 years 5 months) Mountain View, CA Project Description: ​ 
Accessibility testing is a type of systems testing designed to determine whether 
individuals with disabilities will be able to use the system which could be software, hardware, or some other type of system. Disabilities encompass a wide range of physical problems, including learning disabilities as well as difficulties with sight, hearing and movement. Google is committed to making accessibility a core consideration from the earliest stages of product design through release. As a part of core accessibility testing team we mandate to monitor the state of accessibility of all Google products and coordinate accessibility training, testing, and consulting to all products teams. ​ 
Google developed its own assistive technologies like Chromevox for Web and Talkback for android to keep the products accessible for all users who uses assistive technologies.  
 
Responsibilities:  
1. Determining the accessibility standards of various Google Applications using assistive 
technologies like Chromevox for web and Talkback for Android on various devices 
2. Determining the accessibility standards of various Google applications on other OS(Mac 
OS, iOS & Windows) using their proprietary assistive technologies like Voiceover and 
JAWS 
3. Design new methodologies to determine accessibility standards of web and mobile 
products 
4. Bug Tracking and Reporting in Bugnizer.  
5. Defect Tracking and Management.  
6. Identify the severity of issues and escalate jeopardy items to appropriate personnel.  Accessibility Test Engineer Google April 2012  – Present (3 years 5 months) Mountain View, CA Project Description: ​
